document.title: IGCSE Computer Science Syllabus (0478) / 0478 Scheme of Work

2345C5049A3B490F9F94A8E0A18D50EF.description:
(a) Use logic gates to create given logic circuits from a:
(i) problem statement (ii) logicexpression (iii) truth table
(b) Complete a truth table from a: (i) problem statement
(ii) logicexpression
(iii) logic circuit
(c) Write a logic expression from a: (i) problem statement
(ii) logiccircuit
(iii) truth table.

E93F9EC8D767413CBE4445E6A909F189.description: Define and understand the functions of the logic gates.

3DB7CD65B9DC4657BC4A274AC4A165E3.description: Identify and use the standard symbols for logic gates.

833E1BDF4A874A759E4421562E877726.description: Read, understand and complete structured query language (SQL) scripts to query data stored in a single database table.

48B50705552A44DA89CE82EE9CD76069.description: Understand the purpose of a primary key and identify a suitable primary key for a given database table.

265791962C224A95BE19E52AB83561FC.description: Define a single-table database from given data storage requirements.

2400A2D4A2A84F3AA0D379193510A01C.description: Open, close and use a file for reading and writing.

2BAB51A14D5B4FC592838585FF5A14D3.description: Understand the purpose of storing data in files.

4C714AC6F7E14F829546D3D927D8CD5B.description: Write values into and read values from an array using iteration.

4104241B7C834431B285BC96A9EB6707.description: Declare and use one-dimensional (1D) and two-dimensional (2D) arrays.

1910EC1AC28C4195AB68C109713BAD32.description: Understand how to create a maintainable program.

258A6555BB0F470FB730202C5DE510CF.description: Understand what is meant by procedures, functions and parameters; Define and use procedures and functions, with or without parameters; Understand and use local and global variables.

5F3B56C9C9C342FEA91F204157078269.description: Understand and use the concepts of sequence; selection; iteration, totalling; counting; string handling; and arithmetic, logical and Boolean operators.

6A5925B1CCD14F79AE25BC1549E82E16.description: Understand and use input and output.

A5DEB568B078431E81307A8DF9CF9335.description: Understand and use basic data types.

A49095FE15D04ABBB7EEAC767983789D.description: Declare and use variables and constants.

40D936978F9942BDB0647F1DE124F6D3.description: Write and amend algorithms for given problems or scenarios using, pseudocode, program code and flowcharts.

120DF0A0053945BBB14776168DDF276F.description: Identify and suggest ways of correcting of errors in algorithms.

C0E3523BBAF64726A7D1D06D3521BEE3.description: Complete a trace table to document a dry-run of an algorithms.

3870A09A52E54CED95473FC9B2952BF0.description: Suggest and apply suitable test data.

65AAAD3F05B14A5792629E670A1300B0.description: Understand the need for validation checks to be made on input data and the different types of validation check. Understand the need for verification checks to be made on input data and the different types of verification check.

A09D9E22A9FF4DCAB8B0FD59DDA451A3.description: Explain the purpose of a given algorithm.

7AE085AE68094A57B97FB671CB03CD8D.description: Understand that every computer system is made up of sub-systems, which are made up of further sub-systems. Understand how a problem can be decomposed into its component parts. Use different methods to design and construct a solution to a problem

EE50D79A97CF4338818553150B7B25D8.description: Understand the program development life cycle: analysis, design, coding and testing.

6701BEBB7304497C9D369E2EE3E709FD.description: Explain the basic operation and components of AI systems to simulate intelligent behaviour.

E45AB98696D0487BA3BF65396266F930.description: Describe the main characteristics of AI.

3DB46283D00D45A9B0ECCA804649DFCC.description: Understand what is meant by artificial intelligence (AI).

BA767BBEEBBA4564BDCDAB9484843591.description: Understand the roles that robots can perform and the advantages and disadvantages of their use

CD85FFC8E5B84F43847F7A0E11474282.description: Describe the characteristics of a robot.

DCCCBA1479CA4E9FB367F15C47F67FE6.description: Understand what is meant by robotics.

4B5C27D0A0A94DDC9A8EB1707AD29078.description: Describe the advantages and disadvantages of automated systems used for a given scenario.

3537CC9C607442F5BC81149BC91AB59C.description: Describe how sensors, microprocessors and actuators can be used to create automated systems.

D19F9052CE85454B9FEEC5008A8AEE42.description: Explain how a range of solutions are used to help keep data safe from security threats.

275A94FD66B94FA8ABB063A28D079A04.description: Describe the processes involved in, and the aim of carrying out a range of cyber security threats.

B11F039417D14E8994925EDED93D8B19.description: Understand the process of blockchain and how it is used to track digital currency.

70ADB72F374A4BB19C7C5BC98BB39306.description: Understand the concept and use of digital currency.

3B702425701742CEB6D5A3B48DD22F58.description: Explain what is meant by cookies and how they are used, including session cookies and persistent cookies.

0882B8A401B64684A822F3775B812D28.description: Describe how web pages are located, retrieved and displayed of on a device when a user enters a URL.

14260F3DC10346CF8D42F515F029354B.description: Explain the purpose and functions of a web browser.

261B71CD215444A1B39F2547E05C2122.description: Describe the purpose and operation of hypertext transfer protocol (HTTP) and hypertext transfer protocol secure (HTTPS).

77C4D1A0B1C94B31AA1759895DC55732.description: Understand what is meant by a uniform resource locator (URL).

23672ACA8384462FBD7E662BA015E612.description: Understand the difference between the internet and the world wide web.

DB61AE8F05374F06927BDE6C1D9C8CF7.description: Explain the role of an IDE and the common functions it provides.

4EF96E040CEE46AABBF09C6BCC545E28.description: Explain the advantages and disadvantages of a compiler and an interpreter.

18C21130ADD6423283039A72EE227577.description: Describe the operation of a compiler and an interpreter, including how a high-level language is translated by each and how errors are reported.

CA66F09658E74F2B9F09F0441BCDFE70.description: Understand that assembly language is a form of low-level language that uses mnemonics, and that an assembler is needed to translate an assembly language program into machine code.

E4BD31D6286C4FBCB43641F292943EC1.description: Explain what is meant by a high-level language, and low-level language, including the advantages and disadvantages of each.

C04C67C53BC442C69C3D510DA65C45A5.description: Describe the role and operation of interrupts.

4D78EE24085F49179FC176F960D172D1.description: Understand how hardware, firmware and an operating system are required to run applications software.

2439689C7B2D475B8C7201287C632B89.description: Describe the role and basic functions of an operating system.

C4CCECBCC8F14B1C8C527A36DDC565E3.description: Describe the difference between system software and application software and provide examples of each.

05A75FDFFDF940B9885FAF3E85DA99F0.description: Describe the role of a router in a network.

36741D94C2224F6EAF38045D8B845C98.description: Understand what is meant by the purpose of an internet protocol (IP) address. Understand that there are different types IP address.

9A7EFCDC26544B92BE0EBD82C011D998.description: Understand what is meant by the purpose and structure of a media access control (MAC) address, including its structure.

812ED67503084AD1B4F3DFB90B025EEB.description: Understand that a computer needs a network interface card (NIC) to access a network.

1F47AF44DD924FED96AFF69F043184A4.description: Explain the advantages and disadvantages of storing data on the cloud in comparison to storing it locally.

BA7A474F781E4590B2161982B8FD18E0.description: Understand what is meant by cloud storage.

2016E353257E4D4088CB6F9268CCD600.description: Describe what is meant by virtual memory, how it is created, used and why it is necessary

088C568FB4BE40608E33A487A85C3B47.description: Describe the operation of magnetic, optical and solid-state storage and give examples of each.

6B9B23E3C5BC43CCBCFCD750EFE70D0B.description: Understand what is meant by secondary storage.

139DEC77A3494255B6E9E0A271D09E2B.description: Understand what is meant by primary storage.

B01B5FE6E3EC4464BA1804E1E23F58DA.description: Understand what is meant by a sensor and the purpose of sensors. Identify the type of data captured by each sensor, and when each sensor would be used, including selecting the most suitable sensor for a given context.

8E34452318D04F9ABCB7AEE2F3ED1003.description: Understand what is meant by an output device and why it is required.

E16A9D08AEBD499D82E236CB47CA30A5.description: Understand what is meant by an input device and why it is required.

3A753161539047AA9E6E7B8212C287F0.description: Describe the purpose and characteristics of an embedded system and identify devices in which they are commonly used.

D506F2DD47E447FF84053A5687FE8BDA.description: Understand the purpose and use of a CPU instruction set.

48EAA0F8038147B5842DE164AF0EE3D4.description: Understand what is meant by CPU core, cache and clock how they can affect the performance of a CPU.

41759CA9B3194B73AE7A8D910E4A2706.description: Understand the purpose of the components in a CPU, in a computer that has a Von Neumann architecture. Describe the role of each component in the process of the fetch–decode–execute cycle.

8AB08E2C7ED54AAA8DDD486EAC464491.description: Understand the role of the central processing unit (CPU) in a computer. Understand what is meant by a microprocessor.

C52DBF32D94A403AAA367FBC91188AB5.description: Understand how data is encrypted using symmetric and asymmetric encryption.

B897BB3393EA42619EDBEF88C27768D6.description: Understand the need for and purpose of encryption when transmitting data.

56C4816821BC4712807F68B42F3572F6.description: Describe how an automatic repeat request (ARQ) can be used to establish that data is received without error.

9FD0B63FDA0D42A79D680FE38FC0460C.description: Describe how a check digit is used to detect errors in data entry including ISBN numbers and bar codes.

624BBADC9CA245DE9E05D962CCB8A459.description: Describe the processes involved in error detection methods.

B5FB88E3C5A04F908BB4FAF964FBA072.description: Understand the need to check for errors after data transmission and how these errors can occur.

1070886FD4534E06B4295161D0668707.description: Understand the universal serial bus (USB) interface and how it is used to transmit data.

672B1363FD69413BA563958E545356F0.description: Describe how data is transmitted from one device to another using different methods of data transmission. Explain the suitability of the method of data transmission for a given scenario.

3DC82BEDFCC142BAA6336CD99CE1CFDD.description: Understand that data is broken down into packets for transmitted; describe the structure of a packet; describe the process of packet switching.

E6B28EE939244E869732172BFCD9F403.description: 4	Understand how files are compressed using lossy and lossless file compression methods.

B6F57CD99A4D49D1AC331892CA9E7B49.description: Understand the purpose of and need for data compression.

0DA4DA89D5FA4CBBBF46CEA131169EE4.description: Calculate file sizes for image and sound files

B1049B8CD41344FF9A53EEBFDF78D844.description: Understand how data storage is measured.

4BA70D8DF50240CC80B603A21045A7E9.description: 3	Understand how and why a computer represents an image, including the effects of the resolution and colour depth

D49B4AA6E63C4B928333DFA035099ADC.description: Understand how and why a computer represents sound, including the effects of the sample rate and sample resolution.

3C33DFBAE108444CAB6EF8F390D848C1.description: Understand how and why a computer represents text and the use of character sets, including ASCII and Unicode.

A743B51B31974D0AAAB8610945F77808.description: Use two’s complement to represent positive and negative 8-bit binary integers

BF02A8555EAD4FC7A9802A499AB65B35.description: Perform a logical binary shift on a positive 8-bit binary integer and understand the effect this has on the positive binary integer

75847837A8754D9E881CCA17A3339CA5.description:
(a) Add two positive 8-bit binary integers
(b) Understand the concept of overflow and why it occurs in binary addition

A1682C1E48FB4FEA97E8B35BA61E6895.description: Understand how and why hexadecimal is used as a beneficial method of data representation

0EB2C3DEFD5F473A9F97F07A19362172.description:
(a) Understand the denary, binary and hexadecimal number systems. (b) Convert between
(i) positive denary and positive binary
(ii) positive denary and positive hexadecimal
(iii) positive hexadecimal and positive binary

68EDDFD15A7D42BE981E7335F0A1A8F0.description: Understand how and why computers use binary to represent all forms of data
